intro: Pseudolmedia huberi, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of orange and yellow. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its adaptability and attractive blooms, it is widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
